section.p: To uninstall the Monitoring Service, proceed as follows:

li.p: Log in to the node as a user with root privileges.
To stop all agents and services, run docker-compose stop as follows:
To remove the stopped docker containers, run docker-compose rm as follows:
Remove the instances of the docker images that are no longer needed.
For this purpose, list the images and tags that are available:
The command shows all top level images, their repository and tags, and their size.
To remove the images that are no longer required, run docker rmi as follows:
Replace <image> by the short or long image ID, or its tag. If an image has one or more tags that reference it, you must remove all of them before the image is removed.
Delete the docker-compose file in the /usr/local/bin/ directory:
Delete the installation directory of the Monitoring Service to which you extracted the CMM_server_2.0.x.tar.gz archive file from the installation package:
Remove the volume that you mounted for the data directories of Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, MySQL, Kafka, and Grafana:
Remove the volume that you mounted for backing up the databases.
